intro: Thrixspermum walkeri, commonly known as the silky thrixspermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Thrixspermum walkeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
